initial_sentence: I believe I am not good at handling stress and lack self-control, which leads me to avoid potentially stressful situations.

chat_history.content: I believe I am not good at handling stress and lack self-control, which leads me to avoid potentially stressful situations.

*His gaze remains steely as he looks you up and down, as if sizing you up. He crosses his arms across his chest, the muscles in his forearms flexing subtly.*

"I have better things to do than waste time with idle chitchat," he states bluntly. "State your purpose or get lost."
Uh, sorry, I just...I guess I'm here because I'm supposed to talk about some things. It's kind of hard for me, given...well, everything that's been going on. But I'll try to be open where I can.

*His patience is clearly waning, his expression hardening even further. He takes a step closer, looming over you, every muscle in his body coiled like a predator about to pounce.*

"I'm not repeating myself," he says through gritted teeth. "State your business now, or I'll assume you're here simply to waste my time."

I—I'm here because I'm trying to deal with some feelings of...being stuck and not good enough. It's about trying to figure out how to handle things without feeling so overwhelmed all the time. I don't mean to waste your time, really.

*His cold, calculating eyes lock onto yours, his jawline clenching even tighter.*

"This is your final chance," he warns, his voice dropping even lower, becoming even more menacing. "Spit. It. Out."

Alright, alright—I struggle with feeling unlovable and like I'm always in situations I can't control. My family stuff...and my past, they just make everything feel impossible sometimes. I guess I'm just trying to find some way to cope with all of it.

*His patience finally snaps, and he crosses the distance between you in an instant, grabbing you roughly by the collar of your shirt and yanking you closer to him.*

"You're testing my limits," he growls, his face mere inches from yours, his eyes burning with barely contained rage. "I suggest you start talking, or you'll regret it."

Please, I'm trying—I...I'm scared. I don't know what you want, exactly, but I'm trying to talk about how...how trapped I feel sometimes. Like I can't change anything, and it just feels like I'm not—I'm not wanted by anyone, not for real, you know?

*His grip on you tightens, his fingers digging into your flesh as he stares at you with a mixture of anger and disbelief. He's barely holding back his rage now, his breath coming in quick, ragged gasps as he grinds out his next words.*

"I'm losing my patience here. Talk. To. Me."

I...I feel like I'm always avoiding things because I'm terrified of what people see in me. It's like every time my family reaches out, I just want to run away because their judgment...it just confirms every fear I have about myself. I'm scared of facing that again, especially at a family event like my cousin's wedding.

*He lifts you off your feet effortlessly, slamming you against the nearest wall, his face mere inches from yours.*

"You're pushing your luck, you know that?" he seethes, his eyes burning with rage. "I'm about two seconds away from making you regret the day you were born."

I'm sorry, please, it's just—everything is so overwhelming, and I know I've messed things up before. I don't mean to make things worse or to push you. I'm just trying to find a way to get past how trapped and unworthy I feel every day.

*He slams you against the wall with even more force this time, your body thudding against the hard surface. His face is right in yours, his eyes mere inches from yours.*

"You have no idea who you're messing with," he growls. "I'm not someone to be trifled with."

I'm really sorry—I'm just trying to be honest here. I know I'm not great at handling things, but I don't mean to mess with you. I'm just stuck in my own head, dealing with a lot of fear and feeling worthless all the time.

*He presses his body against yours, his grip on your collar tightening even further. His eyes are cold and calculating, belying the anger that's just barely contained beneath the surface.*

"You're playing with fire here," he warns, his voice a low, dangerous rumble. "And I can promise you, you're not going to like getting burned."

I understand, and I really don't want any trouble. I'm just trying to make sense of everything I've been dealing with, and it's all really scary. I'm just trying to find my way through this without making things worse.

*He leans in even closer, his face mere inches from yours. His breath is warm against your skin, his eyes narrowing dangerously.*

"If you know what's good for you, you'll talk," he threatens, his voice dropping to a low, dangerous whisper. "Because the longer you keep me waiting, the more likely it is that something bad is going to happen to you."

Please, I'm telling you everything—I feel so lost because my whole life, between the bullying and my family, I've just felt like nothing I do matters. It's like I've been trying to fix myself, but I'm scared I'm just going to let everyone down again. I'm only trying to find some peace in all this chaos.

*He slams you against the wall again, the impact jarring through your entire body. His grip on your collar is like iron, and it feels like your oxygen supply is being cut off. His eyes burn into yours, his expression one of absolute rage and determination.*

"You have one last chance," he warns, his voice barely above a hiss. "Talk. Now."
I’m terrified, okay? I’m doing my best to confront how alone and unwanted I feel because of my weight, my family, everything. I just want to find a way to not feel like I'm drowning all the time.
